intro: Brathys denticulata, commonly known as the toothed brathys, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its serrated leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink or white. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
